label: 受領
本: Terms and Concepts in Japanese Medieval History . Journal of Japanese Studies . 1983
説明文: Provincial officials in the ritsuryō system who actually governed in their appointed provinces, rather than remaining in the capital. Given full control over tax collection, they prospered and then soildified their ties with the central aristocracy. They were important local supporters of the retired tennō in the eleventh century. Sometimes referred to as tax managers."　[律令、天皇]"
